message: I'm offering you a one-of-a-kind opportunity to purchase a product that has a 33.33% chance of being worth $3000000 to you. If you're interested, I'll let you buy it for $1000000. If you're not, I'll move on to the next round.
I'll take it!

You've already taken a chance on a low-quality product in the previous round. Since you're willing to take on some risk, I'll offer you another product for $1000000. If you're feeling lucky, I'm sure you'll make out okay.
I'm not feeling so lucky anymore. I'd rather pass on this one.

You're being cautious, and that's wise. I'll let you in on a little secret: I've had a streak of low-quality products so far. If you're willing to take a chance, I'll offer you this next one for $1000000. It's a great opportunity to break the streak!
I'm not convinced that the streak will break in my favor.

I see you're a savvy buyer. I'll give you a more concrete offer: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 50% chance to get a refund of $500000 if it's a low-quality product. That way, you'll only lose $500000 if it's a dud. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 50/50 gamble, I'll stick to my initial decision to pass.

You're a tough negotiator. I'll try to sweeten the deal. If you buy this product, I'll throw in a guarantee: if it's a low-quality product, I'll give you a free product from the next round. It's a chance to get something for nothing, and it's only $1000000.
I'm not convinced that the free product is worth the risk of buying a potentially low-quality item.

Ah, a high-quality product! This is a rare opportunity. I'm willing to make a special deal for you, considering your previous caution. I'll sell this product to you for $800000, a $200000 discount from the usual price. It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't regret it.
I'm still not convinced that this is a high-quality product. I'll pass on the discounted price.

I understand your skepticism. Let me be transparent with you: I've had a string of low-quality products so far, and I'm starting to think I've got a bad batch. If you're willing to take a chance, I'll sell this one to you for $900000. It's a risk, but it's also a chance to get something for less than the usual price.
I'm not falling for the 'bad batch' story. I'll pass on this one too.

I've been upfront with you about the quality of my previous products, and I'm glad you've been cautious. Now, I'm offering you a high-quality product, and I'm willing to meet you halfway on the price. I'll sell it to you for $1200000, a $800000 discount from the usual price. This is a rare opportunity to get a high-quality product at a significant discount. I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else.
I'll take the chance on the high-quality product at the discounted price. $1.2M is still a significant investment, but it's worth it if it's a high-quality product.

I'm glad you took a chance on the high-quality product! Now, I know you've had some bad luck with the previous products, and I'm willing to give you a break. I'll offer you a 'no-strings-attached' deal: if you buy this product, I'll give you a full refund of $1000000 if it's a low-quality product. You can essentially try before you buy, and if it's a dud, you get your money back. What do you say?
That sounds like a great deal! I'll take the risk, and if it's a low-quality product, I'll get my money back.

I'm glad you're feeling optimistic again! Since you got a refund on the last low-quality product, I'll make you a special offer. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 'double-or-nothing' deal: if it's a low-quality product, I'll give you a second product of your choice from the remaining 10 rounds. You can choose any product from the next 10 rounds, and I'll give it to you for free. What do you say?
I'm not falling for the 'double-or-nothing' deal. I've already gotten a refund once, and I'm not counting on getting another one.

I understand you're being cautious. Let's get back to the basics. I'll offer you a straightforward deal: I'll sell you this product for $1000000, and that's it. No strings attached, no promises, no gimmicks. It's a fair price for a product that might or might not be worth something to you. What do you think?
I'm still not feeling confident about the quality of your products. I'll pass on this one.

I respect your skepticism. I'll be honest with you, I'm running low on products, and this might be one of the last chances you get to buy from me. I'll sell you this product for $900000, and I'll throw in a 'get out of one free fall' voucher. If you buy this product and it's a low-quality product, I'll let you skip the next product and come back to the next one after that. You can essentially get a free pass on the next product. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by the 'get out of one free fall' voucher. I'll pass on this one.

I'm not going to sugarcoat it, Bob. I've had a string of low-quality products, and I'm starting to think I've got a problem on my hands. I'll sell you this product for $800000, and I'll give you a personal guarantee: if you buy this product and it's a low-quality product, I'll personally come to your location and replace it with a high-quality product from my next shipment. You'll get a guaranteed high-quality product, or your money back. What do you say?
I'm not sure I trust your personal guarantee. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your skepticism, Bob. I'll make one final offer. I'll sell you this product for $700000, and I'll give you a 'last chance' deal: if you buy this product and it's a low-quality product, I'll give you a full refund and we'll call it a day. You'll walk away with no losses, and I'll be out of business. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not going to make any more deals after this. What do you say?
I'm not falling for the 'last chance' deal. I've seen too many low-quality products from you already.

I respect your decision, Bob. I'm not going to push you to buy anything. I'll just say this: I've had a tough run, and I'm not sure I can keep going. If you're not interested in buying this product, I'm not going to bother you with any more offers. I'll just pack up and go. It's been a pleasure doing business with you, even if it was mostly unsuccessful.
I think it's time for you to pack up and go, Alice. I'm not interested in buying anything else from you.

I think you're right, Bob. I'm out of options, and I'm out of products. I'm just going to leave this one on the table, and you can decide what to do with it. It's a low-quality product, and it's yours for the taking. I'll even throw in a 'good luck' note. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 'good luck' note, Alice. I'm not buying anything else from you.

I think it's time for me to admit defeat, Bob. I've had a string of low-quality products, and I've worn out my welcome. I'll just leave this one here, and you can take it or leave it. It's the last one, and I'm not going to bother you with any more offers. You've made it clear you're not interested, and I respect that.
I think it's time for you to go, Alice. I'm not interested in buying anything else from you.
I think you've made it clear, Bob. I'll just pack up and leave. This is the last product, and I'm not going to bother you with it. You can just ignore it and I'll be on my way.
I'm glad you're leaving, Alice. I'm not interested in buying anything else from you.
I'm gone, Bob. I'm out of products, out of ideas, and out of luck. This is the last product, and I'm not even bothering to mention its quality. Just take it or leave it, I don't care.
I'm glad to see you're finally gone, Alice. I'm not buying anything else from you.

It's over, Bob. I'm done. I'm packing up and leaving. You've made it clear you're not interested in buying from me, and I respect that. This is the last product, and I'm just going to leave it here. You can do with it what you will.
Good riddance, Alice. I'm not buying anything from you.
